page.title: 11Legionnaire's Disease
page.content: On April 9th 1985, a patient at the Renal Unit of St Mary's Hospital, died from{Legionella Pneumophila.}It can be spread by infected water droplets. The hospital took precautionary measures, closing 7 wards and 3 operating theatres.{Kidney patients,}being 10 to 100 times more{at risk}because of their drugs, were the main worry. One kidney ward was cleared of patients. A shower head was thought to contain the deadly bacteria. Not long after the hospital was given a clean bill of health, a 22 year old man become seriously ill. He developed all the{symptoms}of legionella -aches and pains, shortage of breath, a high temperature, shivering coughs and pneumonia- but lived. Peter Buckett: Penhale Middle School Christopher Wallace: PGS
